result.execSummary:
The defendant Keshia Lynne Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be collected through the Clerk of Court's Office. A six month commitment order will be imposed, due to non-payment and is to run consecutive to any sentence defendant may be serving at that time.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.
Defendant must make arrangements within the first 60 days of probation to undergo a Psychological/Mental Health evaluation and follow through with any and all recommendations.
Defendant must take any medication that may be prescribed by a treating physician or medical care provider and is to be taken in the manner in which it is prescribed.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns. Defendant must not possess or consume marijuana in any jurisdiction.
Must participate in Forest County Drug Treatment Court, follow all rules, conditions and must successfully complete and graduate from the program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keshia Lynne Morris

records.addlTxt: From DOC with Judge Stenz's note to modify JOC

3:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keshia Lynne Morris appeared by video.  Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus in court for Keshia Lynne Morris. State believes there is a resolution, defendant would plead guilty to counts 1, 2 and 3 as alleged, count 4 would be amended to FC ordinance of possession of drug paraphernalia, counts 5 & 6 would be DRI. Counts 1 and 2 - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years on each count, $500 fine plus costs on each count, count 3 with held sentence - 2 years probation, $500 fine plus costs. Conditions: participate and complete FC wellness program, comply with all rules and graduate from that program, AODA and follow through with any recommendations, obtain a mental health evaluation, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol or MJ including Delta 8, no entry into bars or taverns. Count 4 - would be a fine of $1000 fine plus costs. Morris and Cveykus agree. Court makes sure the defendant understands what it means to have a count DRI. Morris understands. Court DRI counts 5 & 6. Amends count 4 to FCO of drug paraphernalia. Morris pleads guilty to amended charge. Court accepts plea, imposes fine of $1000 plus costs, take bond posted remainder 60 DTP/CO. Morris pleads guilty to counts 1, 2 and 3. Court has PLQ, finds she is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering her plea, waiving her constitutional rights and right to trial. State moves to removed repeater allegation on count 2. Cveykus does not object. Court accepts plea of guilty and adjudges guilty of counts 1, 2 and 3. State makes statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Cveykus makes statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Court concerned as she is in treatment court and makes sure the defendant is willing to proceed with this court. Morris would like to proceed today with this court and makes statement, remorseful. Court has considered all statements and factors, will follow joint recommendation and sentences to: Count 1 & 2 with hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years. Count 3 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years. Conditions of probation: must patriciate in FC treatment court, must follow all rules and conditions and must successfully complete and graduate from the program. AODA and follow through with all recommendations, within 60 days make appointment for psychological evaluation and follow through with any recommendations, take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, no consumption of alcohol or marijuana in any jurisdiction, no entry into any bars or taverns, $500 fine plus costs on each count, grants 60 DTP/CO. Appeal rights given. DNA sample (to be obtained by August 31st) with surcharges. Credit for 45 days if revoked.

2:36 PM Defendant Keshia Lynne Morris appeared by video from Pathways Treatment Center.  Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus appeared by video for Keshia Lynne Morris. Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. State here today for PH, understands it will be waived. Court has PQW, unsigned. Cveykus will upload the signed one, shows signed form to the court on zoom screen. Court goes over the form with Morris, finds she if freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving her right to PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Cveykus waives further reading, will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and will have set for JT.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
No consumption of alcohol, upon request from law enforcement, defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine presence of alcohol or drugs.

10:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keshia Lynne Morris appeared by video, in custody - appears from FOSO.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus appeared by video for Keshia Lynne Morris. Cveykus and Morris have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive time limits as defendant is going into treatment - defendant will appear via Zoom if still in treatment, would like to address bond. Cveykus - bond - asks for a reduction in bond to $1500.00 cash for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections. Court - bond - reduces bond to $1500.00 cash with same conditions if any, sets for PH on 6/23/22 at 2:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000774,
Payable Number: 48861,
Receipt Number: 22R 001387,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:58 AM Defendant Keshia Lynne Morris in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keshia Lynne Morris appeared by video means from FOSO. Morris has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Morris understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, states she has hired Attorney Daniel Cveykus and thought that he would be here today. Attorney Rick Cveykus is here and will appear specially for Daniel Cveykus. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 5/25/22 at 10:30 AM. Morris asks about a hearing date for her revocation. Cveykus will talk to her later about that.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
REFUSED TO SIGN. No consumption of alcohol. Upon request from law enforcement, defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine alcohol level.
